meanings.definition: A person who cleans or polishes a surface by rubbing it hard.
meanings.sent1: The scourers worked diligently to make the floor shiny.
meanings.sent2: I bought new scourers to clean the kitchen tiles.
meanings.sent3: The scourers joked about having to scrub the entire building.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to be the best scourer in town shone through.
meanings.sent5: The scourers' efforts left the windows sparkling and spotless.

meanings.definition: A cleaning implement or pad used for scrubbing.
meanings.sent1: Mom asked me to buy more scourers for the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen sink needed a good scrub with the scourers.
meanings.sent3: The scourers in the cleaning aisle caught my eye with their bright colors.
meanings.sent4: The scourers felt rough against my skin as I scrubbed the dishes.
meanings.sent5: The old scourers were no match for the tough stains on the stove.
